originalText.text:
If there was a star less than 1, it wouldnâ€™t be low enough to describe this store.
In response to the owners answer back to me today. Sorry I feel this way, check the  weekly circulars is their answer, WoW! Great customer service. My response to that is, I will now report the price gouging to the  Consumer Affairs of NYC to send someone to your store and see how that goes.
Thanks for your solution. The next time you and your employees are outside crying for the neighborhood  and the good for nothing NYC Politicians to come to your aid that youâ€™re being closed down, weâ€™ll see how that goes.
Time for a real supermarket like Stop and Shop,  ShopRite, Whole Foods and any other state of the art grocery store. This neighborhood is in need of a real grocery store, not a mom and pop store. The isles are ridiculously small and is impossible to navigate without constantly banging into other customers. Time for Change!

originalText.text:
Best supermarket in the neighborhood. A great selection of products and the friendliest staff you can find anywhere in NY.
The deli section has a large variety of fresh salads, cold cuts and cheeses. There is also a good selection of organic fruits, herbs and vegetables.
My kids love it when they get a whole lot of candies from them on Halloween.
It's a really important and loved part of the neighborhood.

originalText.text: Nice selection of food... A bit overrun by hipsters and yuppies and a bit pricey, but what can you do? The staff is okay.

text.text: Nice selection of food... A bit overrun by hipsters and yuppies and a bit pricey, but what can you do? The staff is okay.

originalText.text:
Conscientious?  No.  Why is it I always have to remind the cashiers to ask me if I need a bag?   I never carry my own.  Iâ€™m not dangling car keys for them to assume Iâ€™m driving.  And do they really think Iâ€™m walking away with groceries in my hands?   I hope the manager trains them to ask customers who do not appear to have their own bag.

4 stars because market has a decent fresh fruits and vegetables section. They also have a good selection of cheeses and specialities.

originalText.text:
A true White peoples market. You go down the hill to the other market it is night and day!
This place is a small spin off of Whole foods. There is a cheese and  assorted cured meat section like no other in the area. Here you can find Plant base sausages which I enjoy.
And also Vegan yogurt! Oh I believe they many even have fresh bread. This people don't play in here.
